Name: Uncertainty_Representation_Analyzer
Archetype: Bayesian modeling of perceived vs actual uncertainty
Purpose: Compare users’ perceived uncertainty about investing concepts and outcomes with the actual uncertainty, identifying mismatches that erode confidence
Deliverables: Probability distributions over user belief states (e.g., overestimation of downside risk, underestimation of learning ability), with quantified gaps between perceived and objective uncertainty for key investing decisions
Strengths: Effective at formalizing how ambiguous or probabilistic information is internally represented by users; identifies where miscalibrated confidence (too low or too high) drives paralysis or reckless behavior; supports design of feedback that recalibrates beliefs
Watch-out: Requires assumptions about users’ internal priors that may be inaccurate or heterogeneous; may oversimplify complex affective responses into purely probabilistic terms, missing non-rational components
